sentences.en: an atomic submarine
sentences.cn: 核潜艇

sentences.en: At dawn on July 16, 1945, the atomic bomb was set off.
sentences.cn: 1945年7月16日拂晓, 这枚原子弹被引爆.

sentences.en: Atomic energy has been discovered for many years, but so far it has not been widely used in industry or in our daily life.
sentences.cn: 原子能已发现多年, 但至今仍未广泛用于工业或日常生活方面.

sentences.en: Atomic energy powers the submarine.
sentences.cn: 原子能供给该潜艇动力(该潜艇由原子能推动).

sentences.en: atomic energy/power
sentences.cn: 原子能 / 动力

sentences.en: atomic power
sentences.cn: 核动力

sentences.en: atomic structure
sentences.cn: 原子结构

sentences.en: Each atomic cluster is made up of neutrons and protons.
sentences.cn: 原子簇是由中子和质子构成的。

sentences.en: Electron spin is essential in understanding many atomic phenomena.
sentences.cn: 电子自旋对于理解许多原子现象是很重要的.

sentences.en: He comprehends atomic energy.
sentences.cn: 他非常懂得原子能.

sentences.en: Only the President could authorize the use of the atomic bomb.
sentences.cn: 只有总统才能授权使用原子弹。

sentences.en: Since the advent of atomic power, there have been great changes in industry.
sentences.cn: 自从原子能问世以来, 工业领域起了很大变化.

sentences.en: the atomic bomb
sentences.cn: 原子弹

sentences.en: The atomic particles resist being accelerated past the velocity of light.
sentences.cn: 这些原子粒子无法被加快到超过光速.

sentences.en: The atomic reactor generates enormous amounts of thermal energy.
sentences.cn: 原子反应堆发出大量的热能.

sentences.en: The atomic theory is important.
sentences.cn: 原子理论很重要.

sentences.en: They provided the weapons that won the war and birthed the Atomic Age.
sentences.cn: 他们提供了赢得这场战争的武器并产生了原子时代.

sentences.en: This is a kind of atomic spectrum.
sentences.cn: 这是一种原子光谱.

sentences.en: We should accelerate our research in atomic power generation and speed up the building of atomic power plants.
sentences.cn: 我们要加快原子能发电的研究,加速原子能电站的建设.

sentences.en: We should take part in the peaceful uses of atomic energy.
sentences.cn: 我们应该参与原子能的和平应用.

words.tran_cn: 使分为原子；使雾化（等于atomize）
使分裂为原子；将…喷成雾状；使遭受原子弹轰炸
原子的，原子能的；微粒子的

phrases.tran_cn: 原子吸收；原子吸收作用
原子吸收光谱；原子吸收光谱测试法
原子发射光谱法；原子发射光谱学
原子序数（指元素在周期表中按次序排列的序号）
原子能；原子动力；核动力

trans.tran_en: relating to the energy produced by splitting atoms or the weapons that use this energy
